DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To evaluate safety cost-effectiveness Short Stay Intensive Care ( SSIC ) treatment low-risk coronary artery bypass patient Design : Randomized clinical equivalence trial Setting : University Hospital Maastricht , Netherlands Patients : low-risk coronary artery bypass patient Interventions : 600 patient randomly assign undergo either SSIC treatment ( 8 hour Intensive Care ) control treatment ( care usual , overnight Intensive Care ) . Measurements : The primary outcome measure Intensive Care ( IC ) readmission total hospital stay . The secondary outcome measure total hospital cost , Quality Life ( QoL ) , postoperative morbidity mortality . Hospital cost consist cost hospital admission ( ) outpatient cost .
